publicwhip.spmotion: *S3M-4844 Christine Grahame: Mary’s Last Letter—That the Parliament notes the forthcoming exhibiting of the last letter written by Mary, Queen of Scots, to her brother just a few hours before her execution by Queen Elizabeth I of England; notes that this important artefact has not been seen in public for 30 years and that its unveiling marks the official opening of a £2.2 million visitor centre at the National Library of Scotland, and further notes the ongoing interest in the life of Queen Mary, who remains a significant figure in Scottish history.
S3M-4844 Mary’s Last Letter (lodged on 14 September 2009) Jamie Hepburn*
S3M-4844 Mary’s Last Letter (lodged on 14 September 2009) Elaine Smith*

S3M-4844 Christine Grahame: Mary’s Last Letter—That the Parliament notes the forthcoming exhibiting of the last letter written by Mary, Queen of Scots, to her brother-in-law just a few hours before her execution by Queen Elizabeth I of England; notes that this important artefact has not been seen in public for 30 years and that its unveiling marks the official opening of a £2.2 million visitor centre at the National Library of Scotland, and further notes the ongoing interest in the life of Queen Mary, who remains a significant figure in Scottish history. Supported by: Jamie Hepburn, Elaine Smith
S3M-4844 Mary’s Last Letter (lodged on 14 September 2009) Shirley-Anne Somerville*
S3M-4844 Mary’s Last Letter (lodged on 14 September 2009) Brian Adam*, Robin Harper*
S3M-4844 Mary’s Last Letter (lodged on 14 September 2009) Stuart McMillan*, Mike Pringle*
S3M-4844 Mary’s Last Letter (lodged on 14 September 2009) Gil Paterson*
S3M-4844 Mary’s Last Letter (lodged on 14 September 2009) Angela Constance*
S3M-4844 Mary’s Last Letter (lodged on 14 September 2009) Bill Kidd*
